p: Anthropogenic climate change occurs due to production of greenhouse gases (GHG), especially CO 2 [ 19, 70, 71]. The increase in CO 2 production can be largely attributed to increasing industrialization [ 70, 71]. Fundamentally, increases in GHG production are due to increased energy use, but can also be attributed to changes in land use, including deforestation, urbanization, and agricultural intensification [ 72, 73]. The rising global demand for meat [ 74, 75] has also led to higher CO 2 emissions [ 76]. Greater use of agricultural inputs of fertilizer have also been implicated in increased GHG emissions [ 77].
